channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Israel court ends draft exemptions for ultra-Orthodox Jews
Team combs fire-ravaged New Mexico community for remains of the missing
item.description: Residents of Ruidoso, New Mexico, return to a fire-ravaged village as search teams look for 29 missing people after devastating wildfires. The fires, which killed at least two and destroyed over 1,500 structures, prompted massive evacuations. Efforts are underway to restore utilities and provide aid, with a disaster declaration facilitating recovery.

item.title: Philippines seeking US clarification on anti-vax propaganda operation
item.description: During the Senate committee hearing, Health Undersecretary Rosario Vergeire highlighted the challenges of combating organized vaccine disinformation. The Philippines continues to seek clarification from the US defense department regarding the clandestine propaganda campaign against Chinese vaccines. The death toll and infection rates underscore the severe impact of the COVID-19 pandemic in the country.

item.title: High risk of famine persists across Gaza, global hunger monitor says
Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore stranded in space station for over two weeks: What is the delay and possible return date
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Stella Assange says will seek a pardon for husband Julian
Assange's parents hail ending to long 'ordeal'
US top secret submarine prototype weapon spotted on Google maps
item.description: The US Navy's strategic responses to Russia and China's underwater drone technology include the development of the Manta Ray prototype. This uncrewed underwater vehicle, built by Northrop Grumman, underwent successful testing off the California coast. The focus on drone technology reflects an evolving arms race in underwater military capabilities worldwide.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Korean Air probes pressure problem on diverted Boeing jet
item.description: Boeing's CEO, Dave Calhoun, acknowledges cultural improvements amid incidents, ensuring ongoing actions for safety and operational enhancements. The company demonstrates commitment to addressing challenges and making progress within its operations.

item.title: Investigators comb wreckage after Seoul lithium battery fire kills 23
item.description: Following the tragic factory blaze, investigations continue as authorities emphasize safety measures and fire prevention. Visits from officials underscore the importance of addressing challenges with lithium fire safety.

item.title: Pashtun Tahafuz Movement holds massive rally to protest military operations in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
item.description: Thousands rallied from Sultan Khel Market to Landi Kotal Bazaar, led by the Pashtun Tahafuz Movement, to protest against military operations and human rights abuses in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The demonstration highlighted rising discontent among Pashtuns and demands for peace and justice.

item.title: New $25,000 IGF Archer-Amish Award for Literature to celebrate Indian storytelling
item.description: Bestselling authors Jeffrey Archer and Amish Tripathi have launched a $25,000 literary award with the India Global Forum to celebrate and nurture contemporary Indian fiction, aiming to elevate storytelling that significantly contributes to the narrative of modern India.

item.title: Nepalese spiritual leader 'Buddha Boy' convicted of sexual assault on minor
item.description: Ram Bahadur Bamjan, aka 'Buddha Boy' was found guilty in Nepal of sexually assaulting a minor. Once known for his motionless meditation, his fall from grace includes allegations of misconduct, casting a shadow over his spiritual claims.

item.title: US ambassador visits conflict-ridden Mexican state to expedite avocado inspections
item.description: Criminal groups in Michoacan engage in avocado smuggling, undermining US inspections. The region's avocado growers face threats from drug gangs, highlighting the risks associated with avocado production in Mexico.

item.title: Why is Julian Assange flying to the remote Pacific island of Saipan?
item.description: Julian Assange traveled to Saipan for a plea deal, aiming to plead guilty and return home after a 14-year legal journey. US prosecutors said Assange wanted to go to a court close to his home of Australia but not in the continental United States. Saipan is the capital of the Northern Mariana Islands (NMI), a US commonwealth in the western Pacific that begins roughly 70 kilometers (44 miles) north of Guam and stretches across 14 islands.

item.title: South Korea slams North Korea's fresh trash balloon launches and threatens loudspeaker broadcasts
item.description: The escalating tensions between North and South Korea, fueled by propaganda campaigns and military threats, reflect broader regional concerns. The growing alliance between Russia and North Korea, with implications for the conflict in Ukraine, raises international alarm. The volatile situation underscores the delicate balance of power in the region.

item.title: Emmanuel Macron: Extreme opposition parties would cause civil war
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron has expressed concern that the agendas of the far-right and far-left in France's upcoming legislative elections could incite civil war. He criticized the far-right National Rally's approach to crime and insecurity for targeting people based on religion or origin, which he believes could lead to division and conflict. Similarly, he accused the far-left France Unbowed of promoting sectarian politics that could provoke hostility.

item.title: Biden 'disturbed' by alleged drowning attack on US-Palestinian child
Amsterdam: Homeless man discovers wallet with 2,000 euros, returns to police
item.description: Homeless man Hadjer Al-Ali found and returned a wallet with 2,000 euros at Amsterdam central station, receiving a 'silver thumb' prize and expressing hope for positive changes in his life.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese forces enter Taiwanese territory, island nation responds as tension grows
item.description: Taiwan reported the detection of 17 Chinese aircraft and eight vessels around the island on Tuesday, a development that could heighten ongoing tensions between Beijing and Taiwan. According to Taiwan's ministry of national defence, Taiwanese forces responded quickly when 10 Chinese aircraft entered its southwestern Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ). This incident underscores the escalating strain in the region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
